resources.string: Fetching latest data, please hold on!
Add desired bus routes to the favourites and they will appear here on the homescreen
Error occurred, please report on mail!
This might occur if Promet Split made some changes to their website.
If Split Bus doesn\'t work please check timetables on the official Promet Split website
Displays all bus routes and stops on the interactive Google Maps map inside the app
All parts of the city are connected by a dense network of bus lines
Except urban city bus lines at the service of passengers there\'s more than a 30 suburban bus lines
Bus traffic in the city of Split and the surrounding area has been divided into four tariff zones
Map displaying all public car parking sites
Map displaying locations of all public car garages

For ease of viewing outside of city interactive map only shows end bus stations. Also most of suburban bus lines don't stop at the urban city bus stations so they're not shown on map as well. 

Since I cannot find anywhere exact bus routes and station locations there can be some wrong map data. If you notice any please report using 'Report wrong data' option below. 
Thank you for your understanding
This app needs the Location permission, please accept to use location functionality
URLs open inside app in custom chrome tabs
Display traffic info on interactive map
Description, changes, bug reports and other app related information

Split Bus helps out citizens and tourists with the public transport in Split. The app is free, open source, packed with features while maintaining simple easy to use design. \n\nApp obtains data directly from Promet d.o.o. website. I cannot be held responsible for their content or availability.

Version 2.5.6 – 18.08.2019 
 *Minor fixes and updates

* Fixed Interactive Map crashes 

 Version 2.5.0 – 04.11.2018 
* Updated design through the app 
* Split Bus became open–source, check source code on the Github 
* Interactive maps are back 
* Added support for Android 9 
* Various small bugfixes 

 Version 2.4.0 – 19.08.2018 
* Timetables are shown once again inside the app. Issues app had before should be gone now for good 
* Added Information section 
* Implemented article pictures inside the news section 
* Number of smaller bugfixes and improvements 

 Version 2.3.0 – 22.07.2018 
* Implemented news section (Croatian only) 

 Version 2.2.2 – 29.05.2018 
* Bugfixes, hopefully fixed force closes on some devices, if they still occur please report them at email 
* Favourites will reset since I've changed db structure 

 Version 2.2.1 – 22.05.2018 
* Favourites are back!
* Introduced Trogir and Šolta timetables
* Fixed crashes on older Android 4.4 devices 

 Version 2.2.0 – 17.05.2018 
* App now supports new Promet Split website
* Detailed description inside the app 

 Version 2.1.3 – 04.09.2017 
*Android O 8.0 support
*Fixed some timetables
NOTICE: Promet Split suddenly started to change timetable urls. In order to keep app updated I have to manually update them in app, so it might happen that app is unable to display latest timetable. I'm sorry for inconveniences that this might cause. If you notice anything feel free to report on mail. 

Version 2.1.2 – 18.08.2017 
*Fixed some timetables
NOTICE: Promet Split suddenly started to change timetable urls. In order to keep app updated I have to manually update them in app, so it might happen that app is unable to display latest timetable. I'm sorry for inconveniences that this might cause. If you notice anything feel free to report on mail.

Q: Why is there no real time information on bus arrivals? 
A: Promet d.o.o. currently doesn't have the required infrastructure. If that changes anytime I will update the app. 

Q: Route on interactive map is wrong! 
A: There's no exact route maps provided anywhere, one you find on the Interactive maps are drawn from my experiences with the buses. If you notice anything off feel free to report the issue and it will be corrected in forthcoming updates. 

Q: On Interactive map there's no bus stops outside the city? 
A: There's a vast number of bus stops outside city, same as the routes, exact data doesn't exist anywhere on the web as well. If you are driving outside the city discuss with the bus driver about the drop off place of your interest. 

Q: What does the open-source app refers to? 
A: Open source in software development refers to apps whose source code is made available for use or modification as users or other developers see fit. Split Bus source code is available on Github under MIT license. 

Q: Are you related with Promet d.o.o.? 
A: No, I don't have any relations with Promet d.o.o. transport company. Regarding any collaboration or building public API no interest have been shown by them so far.
App written and maintained by Antonio Marin. For all bug reports, suggestions, etc. feel free to reach out using the contact form.
